properties.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 31 at 8:02PM PST until January 4 at 4:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
...A LONG PERIOD WEST-NORTHWEST SWELL FROM 290 DEGREES WILL
GENERATE HIGH SURF WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY...

.Highest surf will be on the San Diego County beaches south of Del
Mar.

* Surf...For San Diego County, the surf will be 7-10 ft with the
highest sets south of Del Mar. For Orange County, the surf will
be 5-7 ft.

* Timing...Surf will build Wednesday night into Thursday, peaking
Thursday afternoon, then subside Friday night but is expected
to remain elevated through the weekend.

* Tides...High tide 3.9 ft at 3 PM Thursday and 4.1 ft at 4 PM
Friday.

* Impacts...Dangerous swimming conditions and a high risk of rip
currents. Local beach erosion.
properties.instruction:
A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and
dangerous swimming conditions.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 AM PST SATURDAY
